metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14662 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It was found Ceph versions before 13.2.4 that authenticated ceph users with read only permissions could steal dm-crypt encryption keys used in ceph disk encryption.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14662` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
ceph-common - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
ceph-fs-common - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
ceph-fuse - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
ceph-mds - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
ceph-resource-agents - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
ceph-test - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libcephfs-java - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libcephfs-jni - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libcephfs1 - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
librados2 - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libradosstriper1 - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
librbd1 - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
librgw2 - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
python-ceph - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
python-cephfs - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
python-rados - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
python-rbd - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
radosgw - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
rbd-fuse - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
rbd-mirror - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
rbd-nbd - 10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.2.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
